data.title: Stacey Dash: Wiki, Height, Husband, Net Worth
data.meta_description: American actress Stacey Lauretta Dash works in both film and television. Her films include Clueless (1995), Moving, Mo' Money, Renaissance Man and View
data.text:
American actress Stacey Lauretta Dash works in both film and television. Her films include Clueless (1995), Moving, Mo’ Money, Renaissance Man and View from the Top.

Stacey Dash has appeared on Single Women and Crime Scene Investigation on television. On the reality television series Celebrity Circus, Stacey made an appearance. On the Fox News talk show Outnumbered, Stacey was a co-host.

What is Stacey Dash net worth? Salary, Earnings

As of September 2022, Stacey Dash’s net worth is projected to be $200,000. Her main sources of income are television and movies. In the United States, she is the proud owner of a house in the Bronx. Additionally, she made certain investments that helped her earn $120,000.

Stacey Lauretta Dash, 55, is known for her roles in American films and television shows. Stacey is an inspiration to many because she has been successful in both acting and business. She had a lucrative lingerie line called Letters of Marque. With numerous movies and television shows under her belt, Ella Stacey has been successful in everything she has tried.

Where was Stacey Dash? Ethnicity, Nationality, Family, Education

Stacey Lauretta Dash was born on January 20, 1966 in the Bronx, New York. She has Bajan, African American and Mexican origins. DME Interactive, the first publicly traded African-American-led Internet company, was founded by Stacey’s brother, Darien Stacey.

Damon Dash, Stacey Dash’s first cousin, served as co-founder and former CEO of Roc-A-Fella Records. In 1985, Dash earned his high school diploma in Paramus.

Is Stacey Dash Married? Relationship

Stacey Dash has been married three times. Her first husband was named Brian Lovell (1999 to 2005). She married James Maby for the second time (2005 – 2006).

Her third husband was Emmanuel Xuereb (2009-2011). Austin, who was born in 1991 to R&B musician Christopher Williams, and Lola are the two children of Stacey (b. 2003, fathered by Brian Lovell).

How tall is Stacey Dash? Weight, hair color

As of 2022, Stacey Dash will be 55 years old and was born on January 20, 1967. She is 1.63 m tall and weighs 54 kg.

How did Stacey Dash start her professional career?

In the 1982 NBC crime drama Pilot Farrell, Valerie Harper and Ed O’Neill, Stacey Dash made her acting debut; however, she only appeared in one episode.

Her best-known performance was as Michelle in the 1985 episode “Denise’s Friend” of The Cosby Show. She also appeared in The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air. In 1988’s TV 101, a 13-episode television series that was cancelled, Stacey played her first major television role.

Moving, a comedy by Richard Pryor, featured the outstanding performance of Stacey (1988). She appeared simultaneously in Renaissance Man and Mo’ Money.

In 1995, Stacey played a femme fatale in the teen comedy Clueless and the low-budget film Illegal in Blue. Despite being 28 years old at the time, she played Dionne Davenport, Cher’s best friend since high school. When Stacey played Dionne in the film, it was adapted for television (1996-1999).

After the television series ended, Stacey made appearances in View from the Top (2003), Gang of Roses (2003) and Getting Played (2003). (2005).

He also had some brief cameos on television shows. Some examples are Eve and CSI: Crime Scene Investigation. On the failed television show The Strip, which was canceled after a few episodes, she played Vanessa Weir.

Stacey appears in Carl Thomas’ music video for the song “Emotional” (2001). Kanye West’s music video for the song “All Falling” featured Stacey (2004). Additionally, she was in the music video “Favorite Girl” by Marques Houston (2006). Letters of Marque is a lingerie line founded by Stacey (2006).

Stacey made appearances in several films, including American Primitive, Fashion Victim, Ghost Image, Nora’s Hair Salon II and I Could Never Be Your Woman (2007). She acted in films such as Close Quarters, Phantom Punch and Secrets of a Hollywood Nurse (2008).

She participated in the reality television series Celebrity Circus in 2008. Stacey was injured while practicing before the first episode of the series, but continued performing on the bungee trapeze throughout the competition and reached the finals. She finished behind Antonio Sabàto Jr. in second place.

Stacey frequently appeared on the television show The Game (2009). In VH1’s first scripted series, Single Women, she played Valerie “Val” Stokes (2010).

On August 31, 2011, he left the program to spend more time with his family. Stacey later appeared in Funny or Die and played Lisa in Dysfunction Friends (2012). Stacey Dash Is Normal used YouTube to share trailers and shorts from her web series (2013).

Stacey Dash was nominated for the 1996 Young Artist Award for Best Young Supporting Actress – Feature Film for her work in Clueless (1995).
